item-descriptions.dynamite: A dangerous explosive. It's probably powerful enough to blast through most doors.
item-descriptions.power-armor: A power armor that the Steel Rangers usually wear. Probably the most protective kind of gear you'll ever find in the wastes. It's pretty damn heavy, but the weight is compensated for by increasing the strength of its wearer, while protecting it of magical radiations.

fetchGemstones.objective-give: Bring gemstones to your new diamond dog buddy.
fetchGemstones.objective-mine: Use a pickaxe to mine gemstones in the cavern.
fetchGemstones.title: Gemstones to diamond dog
fetchGemstones.description: You've crossed path with a diamond dog. He asked you to help him gather gemstones, and you accepted. He also lent you the tools you'll need to do the deed. Let's pick up that pickaxe and start mining !

tutorial.description:
You find yourself lost and trapped in the depth of a dark cavern. Resisting the pain of a considerable headache, you have no recollection of how you've gotten here.

The cold and damp air displeases you greatly... how about looking for an exit, and get back to the gracious sky of Equestria ?
tutorial.description-completed: You defeated Trial Blister, one way or another, and access to the outside world was granted to you.
tutorial.description-with-trial: In you search for an exit, you've met Trial Blister. It seems like you were dumped in this cavern as a trial to check your abilities to survive in the desolated land of Equestria. Trial Blister is the last challenge you must overcome to reach the outside world.
tutorial.exit-cavern-success: For completing tutorial, you gained {{xp}} experience points.
tutorial.last-trial-success: For surviving all the trials of the tutorial, you gained {{xp}} experience points.
tutorial.leave-first-room: Find a way to go through the first door.
tutorial.leave-first-room-success: For successfully exiting the first room, you've gained {{xp}} experience points.
tutorial.title: Tutorial
tutorial.win-first-fight-success: For winning your first fight, you've gained {{xp}} experience points.

sampleTownButter.title: Help the baker bake
sampleTownButter.give-butter: You gave butter to the baker.
sampleTownButter.description: The baker needs butter to bake cakes. It seems like the hostel's kitchen hoards a lot of the available ingredients around town.

bubbles.guard-1: Move along, nothing to see here.
bubbles.guard-2: I've got my eye on you.
bubbles.guard-4: It's a peaceful town, here. It'll stay that way.
bubbles.steal-warning-2: Don't test me. Give it back.
bubbles.steal-warning-3: Last warning ! Put that back, or else !
bubbles.steal-warning-4: Guards ! We got a shoplifter over here

town-guard.arrest:
Hands up ! No sudden movements, or I'll shoot to kill.
You've broken the law one too many times pal. You've got some jailtime ahead of you. Follow me nicely and quietly.

town-trader.ask-quest: I'm a bit disappointed. I was expecting to find some sweets. Don't you bake any ?
town-trader.butter-quest-accept: I might be able to help you with that. Let me see what I can do.
town-trader.butter-quest-completed:
Why, you're such a sweetheart ! I'll make a batch of croissants right away ! Just stay still and you'll get to taste those right out o the oven !
[he disappears in the backroom]
town-trader.butter-quest-not-interested: That's too bad. Well, I'll get going then.
town-trader.butter-quest-offer: [sighs heavily] I would love to bake sweeter things. I have some ideas, but ingredients are hard to come by, and the hostel's kitchen hoards pretty much all the available goods around here... if I could get my hands on a good deal of butter, I would be a made pony.
town-trader.croissant-done:
I wasn't too long I hope ? Here, take these [hands you a handful of croissants]
Come back anytime, buddy !
town-trader.give-butter: Here, I found some butter for you ! Can you make some delicacies out of it ?
town-trader.trade-reject: I don't need anything right now. Goodbye !
town-trader.trade-show: Here's what I have in store for you.
town-trader.trade-trigger: Welcome, estimed customer ! What are we trading today ?

tutoCharIntro.start: Wow ! You've arrived ! At long last ! We need to find a way out of this hole !
tutoCharIntro.what-happened: Wait a moment, what's going on ?
tutoCharIntro.scram: Can't you see I'm busy ? Leave me alone
tutoCharIntro.what-happened-response:
I don't know dude ! I woke up in this place, it was dark, moist, and riddled with friggin rats !
I have a strong intuition that we must leave this place though... it's just as if some kind of omniscient puppeteer sent us here, but didn't bother to write us a backstory...
tutoCharIntro.who-are-you-response: Come to think of it... I don't really remember. My name is Helpful Copain, but I conveniently forgot everything else, so I won't bother you with a poorly written backstory.
tutoCharIntro.scram-response: Ooh, sorry big guy, seems like we have a tough one over here !
tutoCharIntro.provoke-further: You better watch your mouth, or else...
tutoCharIntro.provoke-further-response: Or else what ? You gonna kick my ass, is that it ? Hah ! I'd like to see you try !
tutoCharIntro.scram-excuses: Sorry, I didn't mean to be rude. I'd just rather do this on my own.
tutoCharIntro.scram-excuses-response: Alright, I get it... sorry I got carried away myself. Well, if you don't want my help, it can't be helped. Carry on then.
tutoCharIntro.scram-leave: Look, I don't have time for this... see you around, I guess. [Leave]
tutoCharIntro.ask-situation: So, what am I supposed to do ?
tutoCharIntro.aggressively-ask-situation: I don't actually care. Just tell me how to get out of this place.
tutoCharIntro.explain-situation: We need to leave this place. There are two potential ways I know of: on the eastern side, you have the regular entrance for the stable. It's locked though. There are other tunnels on the western side, but they're full of mutated rats. It might lead outside, but I wouldn't know... it's too dangerous to go alone.
tutoCharIntro.enough-details: I think I've got a good enough grasp of the situation. I'll be on my way then. [Leave]
tutoCharIntro.ask-help: You know, I might need some help leaving this cave. Do you mind coming with me ?
tutoCharIntro.provoke-details: So you didn't even try to explore any further ? You're so damn useless, I could slap you.
tutoCharIntro.accept-to-help: Sure, we'll be stronger if we stick together.
tutoCharIntro.decline-to-help: I don't know... you don't look like you can survive out there... I guess I'll just stay here and wait for someone stronger to show up.

parley.change-color: You're lacking in colors. Perhaps we could change that ?
parley.freaking-face: I've got a freaking face and all ! Isn't that cool enough ?!
parley.greetings: Hi there ! Gosh, it's been a while ! What's happening ?
parley.greetings-alt: Hi again. Is there something else ?
parley.no-mane: Looks like I was too lazy to give you a mane...
parley.rep1: You're damn right, "it's been a while" ! It's about time we get to work, isn't it ?
parley.rep2: Well, I've been pretty busy... but lately, I had an illumination of sorts, and I decided to see this thing to the end.
parley.rep3: Let's cut to the chase. Show me something cool

medicine-skill.in-combat: You can't use medicine during combat
medicine-skill.used-on: {{user}} used medicine on {{target}} and healed it for {{hp}} hit points.

descriptions.strength: Raw physical strength. A high Strength is good for physical characters.
descriptions.perception: The ability to see, hear, taste and notice unusual things. A high Perception is important for a sharpshooter.
descriptions.endurance: Stamina and physical toughness. A character with a high Endurance will survive where others may not.
descriptions.charisma: A combination of appearance and charm. A high Charisma is important for characters that want to influence people with words.
descriptions.intelligence: Knowledge, wisdom and the ability to think quickly. A high Intelligence is important for any character.
descriptions.agility: Coordination and the ability to move well. A high Agility is important for any active character.
descriptions.luck: Fate. Karma. An extremely high or low Luck will affect the character - somehow. Events and situations will be changed by how lucky (or unlucky) your character is.
descriptions.hitPoints: How much damage your character can take before dying. If you reach 0 HP or less, you are dead.
descriptions.carryWeight: The maximum amount of equipment your character can carry, in pounds.
descriptions.armorClass: Modifies the chance to hit this particular character.
descriptions.actionPoints: The number of actions that the character can take during one combat turn.
descriptions.meleeDamage: The amount of bonus damage your character does in hand-to-hand combat.
descriptions.damageResistance: Any damage taken is reduced by this amount. Damage Resistance can be increased by wearing armor.
descriptions.poisonResistance: Reduces poison damage by this amount.
descriptions.radiationResistance: The amount of radiation you are exposed to is reduced by this percentage. Radiation Resistance can be modified by the type of armor worn, and anti-radiation chems.
descriptions.sequence: Determines how soon in a combat turn your character can react.
descriptions.healingRate: The natural ability of your body to process and heal. You will heal faster if you rest.
descriptions.criticalChance: The chance to cause a critical hit in combat is increased by this amount.
descriptions.bloody-mess: By some strange twist of fate, people around you die violently. You always see the worst way a person can die.
descriptions.bruiser: A little slower, but a little bigger. You may not hit as often, but they will feel it when you do! Your total action points are lowered, but your Strength is increased.
descriptions.chem-resistant: Chems only affect you half as long as normal, but your chance to be addicted is also only 50% of normal.
descriptions.fast-metabolism: Your metabolic rate is twice normal. This means that you are much less resistant to radiation and poison, but your body heals faster.
descriptions.finesse: Your attacks show a lot of finesse. You don't do as much damage, but you cause more critical hits.
descriptions.gifted: You have more innate abilities than most, so you have not spent as much time honing your skills.
descriptions.heavy-handed: You swing harder, not better. Your attacks are very brutal, but lack finesse. You rarely cause a good critical hit, but you always do more melee damage.
descriptions.jinxed: The good thing is that everyone around you has more critical failures, the bad thing is - so do you!
descriptions.kamikaze: By not paying attention to any threats, you can act a lot faster in a turn. This lowers your Armor Class to just what you are wearing, but you sequence much faster in a combat turn.
descriptions.sex-appeal: You've got the "right" stuff. Members of the opposite sex are attracted to you, but those of the same sex tend to become quite jealous.
descriptions.skilled: Since you spend more time improving your skills than a normal person, you gain more skill points. The tradeoff is that you do not gain as many extra abilities. You will gain a perk every four levels. You will get an additional 5 skill points per new experience level.
descriptions.small-frame: You are not quite as big as other people, but that never slowed you down. You can't carry as much, but you are more agile.
descriptions.smallGuns: The use, care and general knowledge of small firearms - pistols, SMGs and rifles.
descriptions.bigGuns: The operation and maintenance of really big guns - miniguns, rocket launchers, flamethrowers and such.
descriptions.energyGuns: The care and feeding of energy-based weapons. How to arm and operate weapons that use laser or plasma technology.
descriptions.throwing: The skill of muscle-propelled ranged weapons, such as throwing knives, spears and grenades.
descriptions.explosives: The finding and removal of traps. Also the setting of explosives for demolition purposes.
descriptions.meleeWeapons: Using non-ranged weapons in hand-to-hand or melee combat - knives, sledgehammers, spears, clubs and so on.
descriptions.unarmed: A combination of martial arts, boxing and other hand-to-hand martial arts. Combat with your hands and feet.
descriptions.repair: The practical application of the Science skill, for fixing of broken equipment, machinery and electronics
descriptions.science: Covers a variety of high-technology skills, such as computers, biology, physics, and geology.
descriptions.sneak: Quiet movement, and the ability to remain unnoticed. If successful, you will be much harder to locate. You cannot run and sneak at the same time.
descriptions.steal: The ability to make things of others your own. Can be used to steal from people or places.
descriptions.outdoorsman: Practical knowledge of the outdoors, and the ability to live off the land. The knowledge of plants and animals.
descriptions.barter: Trading and trade-related tasks. The ability to get better prices for items you sell, and lower prices for items you buy.
descriptions.speech: The ability to communicate in a practical and efficient manner. The skill of convincing others that your position is correct. The ability to lie and not get caught.
descriptions.lockpick: The skill of opening locks without the proper key. The use of lockpicks or electronic lockpicks will greatly enhance this skill.
descriptions.medicine: Medical knowledge. The ability to treat wounds, cure diseases, and apply first aid.
descriptions.gambling: The knowledge and practical skills related to wagering. The skill at cards, dice and other games.
descriptions.spellcasting: Knowledge of spells and magic. Ability to cast spells (if relevant) and affinity with your inner magic.

buffs.poisoned: You've been poisoned ! You will periodically take damage until the poison is drained from your body (unless you die before that happens). You may want to find an antidote.
buffs.drunk: You have succumbed to Bacchus' call. You don't feel as sharp as usual. Actually, you don't feel much of anything, right now.
buffs.ko: You lost consciousness, possibly due to a shock or an intoxication. Depending on the cause and on your own constitution, you may wake up in a matter of seconds... or hours. The waiting game begins.
